title: RViz2 with Autoware configuration crashes on high DPI
body:
### Checklist

- [X] I've read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/autowarefoundation/autoware/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md).
- [X] I've searched other issues and no duplicate issues were found.
- [X] I'm convinced that this is not my fault but a bug.

### Description

If the screen dpi is normal, which is generally `xrandr --dpi 96` Autoware RViz2 will function correctly.

But because of some plugins, when the `xrandr --dpi 200` is applied, the RViz2 keeps crashing and restarting.

Also this issue won't happen if you just run the RViz2 with Autoware config with (Autoware shouldn't run, only the rviz2 must be alive):
```
ros2 run rviz2 rviz2 -d /home/mfc/projects/autoware/install/autoware_launch/share/autoware_launch/rviz/autoware.rviz -s /home/mfc/projects/autoware/install/autoware_launch/share/autoware_launch/rviz/image/autoware.png --ros-args -p use_sim_time:=true
```

But if you open the rest of the Autoware, it will crash with a `[ros2run]: Segmentation fault`.

Which plugin causes it, must be investigated.

### Expected behavior

RViz2 runs correctly.

### Actual behavior

RViz2 keeps crashing and restarting.

### Steps to reproduce

```bash
xrandr --dpi 200

ros2 launch autoware_launch planning_simulator.launch.xml map_path:=$HOME/autoware_map/sample-map-planning vehicle_model:=sample_vehicle sensor_model:=sample_sensor_kit
```

[Planning simulator tutorial detailed docs.](https://autowarefoundation.github.io/autoware-documentation/main/tutorials/ad-hoc-simulation/planning-simulation/#1-launch-autoware) 

### Versions

- OS: Ubuntu 22.04
- ROS 2: humble
- Autoware: main

### Possible causes

Some handwritten Autoware plugins cannot cope with varying dpi.

### Additional context

Related Issues & Discussions:
- https://github.com/autowarefoundation/autoware/issues/3173
- https://github.com/orgs/autowarefoundation/discussions/3474
- https://github.com/orgs/autowarefoundation/discussions/3121

title: Reduce excessive error and warning logs on Autoware launch
body:
### Checklist

- [X] I've read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/autowarefoundation/autoware/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md).
- [X] I've searched other issues and no duplicate issues were found.
- [X] I've agreed with the maintainers that I can plan this task.

### Description

When Autoware is executed, it generates a significant number of warning and error logs, despite the system running as expected. The logs are not only excessive but also misrepresent the stability of the running application, as they appear even in the absence of actual functional issues. This creates a noisy debugging environment, making it challenging to identify and address genuine issues.

The issue was replicated using the latest `main` branch with the planning simulator demo as per the Autoware documentation: [Planning Simulation Tutorial](https://autowarefoundation.github.io/autoware-documentation/main/tutorials/ad-hoc-simulation/planning-simulation/).

A video demonstrating the issue is available here:
- [Autoware Error and Warning Logs Video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JDXDh1oNaMg)

The logs from the run that showcase the problem can be found here:
- [Autoware Logs Gist](https://gist.github.com/xmfcx/aebd2fe8a9a7c08a388aafae69dd110a)

### Purpose

The primary goal is to clean up the logs by either resolving the underlying causes of the warnings and errors or by adjusting the threat levels if the logs are not indicative of real issues.
This will aid in de-cluttering the console output, making it easier to debug actual problems, and generally improve the developer experience.


### Possible approaches

1. **Log Analysis**: Go through the logs to determine if the warnings/errors are justified. If they represent real issues, then they should be addressed with bug fixes.
2. **Adjust Log Levels**: If the logs are overly cautious and do not represent actual errors or critical warnings, then the log levels should be adjusted accordingly.
3. **Code Refactoring**: Inspect the sections of the code-base that are generating these logs and refactor if necessary to prevent false positives.
4. **Configuration Tweaks**: Check if the verbosity of the logs can be configured, allowing users to set the desired level of log detail.
5. **Documentation Update**: If certain logs are expected and do not indicate problems, this should be clearly documented to avoid confusion. (last resort, not preferred)
6. **Incremental Fixing**: Tackle the errors and warnings in batches, creating multiple issues or pull requests to address them systematically.

### Definition of done

- [ ] The error and warning logs that are not indicative of actual issues are eliminated or their threat levels are adjusted.
- [ ] The logging output should be clear and should accurately reflect the operational status of Autoware.
- [ ] Documentation should be updated, if necessary, to reflect any changes made to log management.
- [ ] Additional issues should be created for any unresolved logs that require further investigation or long-term changes.
- [ ] The Autoware community agrees that the logging is now informative and not excessively verbose, allowing for effective debugging.

title: Cannot use the filter to leave out specific nodes or topics
body:
### Checklist

- [X] I've read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/tier4/caret/blob/main/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md).
- [X] I've read [document](https://tier4.github.io/CARET_doc/main/) and no solution were found.

### Issue type

Help wanted

### Step where the issue is related to

Recording

### Environments


    OS: Ubuntu 22.04.3 LTS
    ROS 2: Humble
    Memory: 64.0 GiB


### CARET version


    CARET: v0.3.3  main branch


### Target application

target application: autoware release/2023.10 branch

### Description

Although in the tutorial section I noticed that there are nodes/topics filter provided to leave out or just focus on some specific nodes and topics, as I use the CLI tool as described in the tutorial, the final tracing result still has nodes and topics that I intend to leave out, resulting in very high latency in data analysis using python APIs. I tried to use the echo to see if the nodes are correctly sent to the $CARET_IGNORE_NODES and they did. I would appreciate it if some more specific instructions on how to use the filters could be posted here, thanks!

title: Use the cluster speed when limiting speed
body:
The Problem:

Openpilot displays the current speed based off of the speed that is shown in the car's cluster. This is done to prevent a disparity between the car and the information that openpilot is giving, that disparity can lead to less confidence from the user that openpilot is correct. However, the internal openpilot speed is used to limit speed. This leads to openpilot sometimes showing a speed above the set max speed which reduces user confidence that openpilot is correctly limiting based off of the users' max speed setting.

The Solution:
By calculating the difference between the cluster speed and vEgo we can determine the maximum speed that will result in the cluster speed matching the speed the user has set.

title: Honda: check regen paddle
body:
### Describe the bug

## TL;DR

Honda Insight's brake regen adjustment paddles cause OP to throw a CruiseDisabled error instead of canceling cruise control.

## More Info

The Honda Insight has adjustable regenerative braking. This is controlled by paddles on the steering wheel. Hitting either paddle when cruise is engaged will disengage cruise. 

Disengaging cruise control in this fashion causes OP to trigger a "cruise not engaged" message and sound the alarm, instead of gracefully exiting cruise control via the "Cancel" button. This is governed in the Honda interface, [L332](https://github.com/commaai/openpilot/blob/a2bb41e0ec5fd96763e9a01a7116efda059de6e6/selfdrive/car/honda/interface.py#L332).  

It appears that the car sends a generic "Cruise Control disabled" message; there's a lot of junk in Cabana for this trip which isn't mapped to any signals, but one of those could be the issue.

### Desired Outcome

When using the steering wheel paddles to disable cruise control, OP should treat this as a standard disablement instead of an emergency.

### Which car does this affect?

Honda Insight EX 2019

### Provide a route where the issue occurs

8958942b212e8cd9|2023-11-30--08-18-06--10

### openpilot version

On `release3`, latest release.

title: [BUG] infinite loop for incomplete spread
body:
Currently version used for `apollo_parser` crate infinite loop for incomplete spreads in passed graphQL string body.
Being a synchronous task it blocks the process, thus no error is thrown and it keeps on running (unless swc's thread for the file timeout).

This is fixed in version 0.50.x via https://github.com/apollographql/apollo-rs/pull/463

Need to add error handling to graphql ast -> swc ast translation for this version upgrade as few cases like empty named type are not being through from `apollo_parser` at time of parsing query string.

title: Autoware keeps following old local path after `behavior_velocity_planner` is dead
body:
### Checklist

- [X] I've read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/autowarefoundation/autoware/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md).
- [X] I've searched other issues and no duplicate issues were found.
- [X] I'm convinced that this is not my fault but a bug.

### Description

While I experienced the `behavior_velocity_planner` crash (described here: https://github.com/autowarefoundation/autoware.universe/issues/1247), I observed autoware did not make the vehicle stop immediately after the crash, but kept driving along the last generated local path, reached the end of the local path and kept driving straight after. Autoware only triggered an emergency stop when the vehicle was ~3m beyond that last point (out of path detected).

Although the out of path detection range could be reduced to have the emergency triggered earlier, it is very unsafe for autoware to keep following an old local path. For example, even though some new obstacle would be detected on the road, autoware would simply ignore them and follow the last local path it has received.

### Expected behavior

An emergency should be triggered if local paths are not generated anymore

### Actual behavior

Autoware keep driving on the old path, even after its end has been reached.

### Steps to reproduce

1. run autoware on a vehicle
2. kill `behavior_velocity_planner` while in autonomous mode

### Versions

- Ubuntu 20.04
- galactic
- main

### Possible causes

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_

title: Error when opentelemetry is enabled
body:
Hi!
We're getting the following error after configuring opentelemetry support in `dd-trace-js`.

```
"TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'sample')",
"    at DatadogSpan._addTags (/usr/src/app/node_modules/dd-trace/packages/dd-trace/src/opentracing/span.js:238:27)",
"    at DatadogSpan.addTags (/usr/src/app/node_modules/dd-trace/packages/dd-trace/src/opentracing/span.js:138:10)",
"    at Span.setAttributes (/usr/src/app/node_modules/dd-trace/packages/dd-trace/src/opentelemetry/span.js:92:18)",
"    at Tracer.startSpan (/usr/src/app/node_modules/dd-trace/packages/dd-trace/src/opentelemetry/tracer.js:96:10)",
"    at Tracer.startActiveSpan (/usr/src/app/node_modules/dd-trace/packages/dd-trace/src/opentelemetry/tracer.js:113:23)",
"    at ApolloGateway.executor [as gatewayExecutor] (/usr/src/app/node_modules/@apollo/gateway/dist/index.js:53:43)",
"    at execute (/usr/src/app/node_modules/@apollo/server/dist/cjs/requestPipeline.js:225:44)",
"    at processGraphQLRequest (/usr/src/app/node_modules/@apollo/server/dist/cjs/requestPipeline.js:158:38)",
"    at process.processTicksAndRejections (node:internal/process/task_queues:95:5)",
"    at async internalExecuteOperation (/usr/src/app/node_modules/@apollo/server/dist/cjs/ApolloServer.js:634:16)"
```
The project is basically a apollo server / gateway.

Any clue where to look on how to resolve this in case that's not a bug?

**Expected behaviour**
Shouldn't crash I guess.

**Actual behaviour**
Is crashing

**Steps to reproduce**
That's our tracer initialization code:

```
const tracer = require('dd-trace')
const { TracerProvider } = tracer
tracer.init({
  plugins: true,
  runtimeMetrics: true
})

tracer.use('express')

tracer.use('graphql', {
  signature: false,
  source: true
})

const provider = new TracerProvider()
provider.register()

module.exports = tracer
```

When removing the
```
const provider = new TracerProvider()
provider.register()
```
it works just fine - but then we don't get the [opentelemetry spans emitted by the apollo gateway.](https://www.apollographql.com/docs/federation/opentelemetry/#gateway-specific-spans)

**Environment**

* **Operation system:** Linux
* **Node.js version:** 18
* **Tracer version:** 4.17.0
* **Agent version:** unknown
* **Relevant library versions:** 

```
"@apollo/gateway": "^2.5.6",
"@apollo/server": "^4.9.5",
```

title: Build fails after schema file rename when Gradle configuration cache enabled
body:
### Version

3.8.2 and 4.0.0-beta.3

### Summary

Currently build fails if you rename schema file and configuration cache was enabled. Take a look at the steps to reproduce issue below.

**My current workaround**
I have little bit investigated this and it seems the problem in the following code (schema files searched in a non-compatible way with configuration cache)
https://github.com/apollographql/apollo-kotlin/blob/84f0f9253765ff4bfd8f223539fefd24e8da0488/libraries/apollo-gradle-plugin-external/src/main/kotlin/com/apollographql/apollo3/gradle/internal/DefaultApolloExtension.kt#L965-L970

To workaround this, I set `Service.schemaFiles` directly instead of relying on default behavior.
https://github.com/apollographql/apollo-kotlin/blob/84f0f9253765ff4bfd8f223539fefd24e8da0488/libraries/apollo-gradle-plugin-external/src/main/kotlin/com/apollographql/apollo3/gradle/api/Service.kt#L83

```
apollo {
    service("main") {
        srcDir("src/main/graphql")
        schemaFiles.setFrom(
            fileTree("src/main/graphql") {
                include("**/*.graphqls")
            }
        )
    }
}
```

PS: since in my project I have multiple schema files, I cannot use just `Service.schemaFile` for single file

### Steps to reproduce the behavior

**Steps**
1) Create simple `my_lib` module and use default configuration for Apollo plugin. Place GQL schema file into main sources: `/Users/user/projects/sample/my_lib/src/main/graphql/schema.graphqls`
2) Build module with configuration cache enabled `./gradlew :my_lib:assembleDebug --configuration-cache`
3) Rename `schema.graphqls` to `schema2.graphqls`
4) Build module again with configuration cache enabled `./gradlew :my_lib:assembleDebug --configuration-cache`

**Actual result**
The second build fails with error
```
> Task :my_lib:generateMainApolloSources FAILED
Execution failed for task ':my_lib:generateMainApolloSources'.
> java.io.FileNotFoundException: /Users/user/projects/sample/my_lib/src/main/graphql/schema.graphqls (No such file or directory)

* Try:
> Run with --stacktrace option to get the stack trace.
> Run with --info or --debug option to get more log output.
> Run with --scan to get full insights.
> Get more help at https://help.gradle.org.
BUILD FAILED in 307ms
122 actionable tasks: 6 executed, 116 up-to-date
Configuration cache entry reused.
```

**Expected result**
Build must success




### Logs

_No response_

title: RViz2 with Autoware configuration crashes on high DPI
body:
### Checklist

- [X] I've read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/autowarefoundation/autoware/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md).
- [X] I've searched other issues and no duplicate issues were found.
- [X] I'm convinced that this is not my fault but a bug.

### Description

If the screen dpi is normal, which is generally `xrandr --dpi 96` Autoware RViz2 will function correctly.

But because of some plugins, when the `xrandr --dpi 200` is applied, the RViz2 keeps crashing and restarting.

Also this issue won't happen if you just run the RViz2 with Autoware config with (Autoware shouldn't run, only the rviz2 must be alive):
```
ros2 run rviz2 rviz2 -d /home/mfc/projects/autoware/install/autoware_launch/share/autoware_launch/rviz/autoware.rviz -s /home/mfc/projects/autoware/install/autoware_launch/share/autoware_launch/rviz/image/autoware.png --ros-args -p use_sim_time:=true
```

But if you open the rest of the Autoware, it will crash with a `[ros2run]: Segmentation fault`.

Which plugin causes it, must be investigated.

### Expected behavior

RViz2 runs correctly.

### Actual behavior

RViz2 keeps crashing and restarting.

### Steps to reproduce

```bash
xrandr --dpi 200

ros2 launch autoware_launch planning_simulator.launch.xml map_path:=$HOME/autoware_map/sample-map-planning vehicle_model:=sample_vehicle sensor_model:=sample_sensor_kit
```

[Planning simulator tutorial detailed docs.](https://autowarefoundation.github.io/autoware-documentation/main/tutorials/ad-hoc-simulation/planning-simulation/#1-launch-autoware) 

### Versions

- OS: Ubuntu 22.04
- ROS 2: humble
- Autoware: main

### Possible causes

Some handwritten Autoware plugins cannot cope with varying dpi.

### Additional context

Related Issues & Discussions:
- https://github.com/autowarefoundation/autoware/issues/3173
- https://github.com/orgs/autowarefoundation/discussions/3474
- https://github.com/orgs/autowarefoundation/discussions/3121

title: Reduce excessive error and warning logs on Autoware launch
body:
### Checklist

- [X] I've read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/autowarefoundation/autoware/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md).
- [X] I've searched other issues and no duplicate issues were found.
- [X] I've agreed with the maintainers that I can plan this task.

### Description

When Autoware is executed, it generates a significant number of warning and error logs, despite the system running as expected. The logs are not only excessive but also misrepresent the stability of the running application, as they appear even in the absence of actual functional issues. This creates a noisy debugging environment, making it challenging to identify and address genuine issues.

The issue was replicated using the latest `main` branch with the planning simulator demo as per the Autoware documentation: [Planning Simulation Tutorial](https://autowarefoundation.github.io/autoware-documentation/main/tutorials/ad-hoc-simulation/planning-simulation/).

A video demonstrating the issue is available here:
- [Autoware Error and Warning Logs Video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JDXDh1oNaMg)

The logs from the run that showcase the problem can be found here:
- [Autoware Logs Gist](https://gist.github.com/xmfcx/aebd2fe8a9a7c08a388aafae69dd110a)

### Purpose

The primary goal is to clean up the logs by either resolving the underlying causes of the warnings and errors or by adjusting the threat levels if the logs are not indicative of real issues.
This will aid in de-cluttering the console output, making it easier to debug actual problems, and generally improve the developer experience.


### Possible approaches

1. **Log Analysis**: Go through the logs to determine if the warnings/errors are justified. If they represent real issues, then they should be addressed with bug fixes.
2. **Adjust Log Levels**: If the logs are overly cautious and do not represent actual errors or critical warnings, then the log levels should be adjusted accordingly.
3. **Code Refactoring**: Inspect the sections of the code-base that are generating these logs and refactor if necessary to prevent false positives.
4. **Configuration Tweaks**: Check if the verbosity of the logs can be configured, allowing users to set the desired level of log detail.
5. **Documentation Update**: If certain logs are expected and do not indicate problems, this should be clearly documented to avoid confusion. (last resort, not preferred)
6. **Incremental Fixing**: Tackle the errors and warnings in batches, creating multiple issues or pull requests to address them systematically.

### Definition of done

- [ ] The error and warning logs that are not indicative of actual issues are eliminated or their threat levels are adjusted.
- [ ] The logging output should be clear and should accurately reflect the operational status of Autoware.
- [ ] Documentation should be updated, if necessary, to reflect any changes made to log management.
- [ ] Additional issues should be created for any unresolved logs that require further investigation or long-term changes.
- [ ] The Autoware community agrees that the logging is now informative and not excessively verbose, allowing for effective debugging.

For general design discussions, please post on discourse: https://discourse.ros.org/c/ng-ros

## Bug report

title: Use the cluster speed when limiting speed
body:
The Problem:

Openpilot displays the current speed based off of the speed that is shown in the car's cluster. This is done to prevent a disparity between the car and the information that openpilot is giving, that disparity can lead to less confidence from the user that openpilot is correct. However, the internal openpilot speed is used to limit speed. This leads to openpilot sometimes showing a speed above the set max speed which reduces user confidence that openpilot is correctly limiting based off of the users' max speed setting.

The Solution:
By calculating the difference between the cluster speed and vEgo we can determine the maximum speed that will result in the cluster speed matching the speed the user has set.

title: Honda: check regen paddle
body:
### Describe the bug

## TL;DR

Honda Insight's brake regen adjustment paddles cause OP to throw a CruiseDisabled error instead of canceling cruise control.

## More Info

The Honda Insight has adjustable regenerative braking. This is controlled by paddles on the steering wheel. Hitting either paddle when cruise is engaged will disengage cruise. 

Disengaging cruise control in this fashion causes OP to trigger a "cruise not engaged" message and sound the alarm, instead of gracefully exiting cruise control via the "Cancel" button. This is governed in the Honda interface, [L332](https://github.com/commaai/openpilot/blob/a2bb41e0ec5fd96763e9a01a7116efda059de6e6/selfdrive/car/honda/interface.py#L332).  

It appears that the car sends a generic "Cruise Control disabled" message; there's a lot of junk in Cabana for this trip which isn't mapped to any signals, but one of those could be the issue.

### Desired Outcome

When using the steering wheel paddles to disable cruise control, OP should treat this as a standard disablement instead of an emergency.

### Which car does this affect?

Honda Insight EX 2019

### Provide a route where the issue occurs

8958942b212e8cd9|2023-11-30--08-18-06--10

### openpilot version

On `release3`, latest release.

### Additional info

_No response_

title: [BUG] infinite loop for incomplete spread
body:
Currently version used for `apollo_parser` crate infinite loop for incomplete spreads in passed graphQL string body.
Being a synchronous task it blocks the process, thus no error is thrown and it keeps on running (unless swc's thread for the file timeout).

This is fixed in version 0.50.x via https://github.com/apollographql/apollo-rs/pull/463

Need to add error handling to graphql ast -> swc ast translation for this version upgrade as few cases like empty named type are not being through from `apollo_parser` at time of parsing query string.

title: Autoware keeps following old local path after `behavior_velocity_planner` is dead
body:
### Checklist

- [X] I've read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/autowarefoundation/autoware/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md).
- [X] I've searched other issues and no duplicate issues were found.
- [X] I'm convinced that this is not my fault but a bug.

### Description

While I experienced the `behavior_velocity_planner` crash (described here: https://github.com/autowarefoundation/autoware.universe/issues/1247), I observed autoware did not make the vehicle stop immediately after the crash, but kept driving along the last generated local path, reached the end of the local path and kept driving straight after. Autoware only triggered an emergency stop when the vehicle was ~3m beyond that last point (out of path detected).

Although the out of path detection range could be reduced to have the emergency triggered earlier, it is very unsafe for autoware to keep following an old local path. For example, even though some new obstacle would be detected on the road, autoware would simply ignore them and follow the last local path it has received.

### Expected behavior

An emergency should be triggered if local paths are not generated anymore

### Actual behavior

Autoware keep driving on the old path, even after its end has been reached.

### Steps to reproduce

1. run autoware on a vehicle
2. kill `behavior_velocity_planner` while in autonomous mode

### Versions

- Ubuntu 20.04
- galactic
- main

_No response_

title: Build fails after schema file rename when Gradle configuration cache enabled
body:
### Version

3.8.2 and 4.0.0-beta.3

### Summary

Currently build fails if you rename schema file and configuration cache was enabled. Take a look at the steps to reproduce issue below.

**My current workaround**
I have little bit investigated this and it seems the problem in the following code (schema files searched in a non-compatible way with configuration cache)
https://github.com/apollographql/apollo-kotlin/blob/84f0f9253765ff4bfd8f223539fefd24e8da0488/libraries/apollo-gradle-plugin-external/src/main/kotlin/com/apollographql/apollo3/gradle/internal/DefaultApolloExtension.kt#L965-L970

To workaround this, I set `Service.schemaFiles` directly instead of relying on default behavior.
https://github.com/apollographql/apollo-kotlin/blob/84f0f9253765ff4bfd8f223539fefd24e8da0488/libraries/apollo-gradle-plugin-external/src/main/kotlin/com/apollographql/apollo3/gradle/api/Service.kt#L83

```
apollo {
    service("main") {
        srcDir("src/main/graphql")
        schemaFiles.setFrom(
            fileTree("src/main/graphql") {
                include("**/*.graphqls")
            }
        )
    }
}
```

PS: since in my project I have multiple schema files, I cannot use just `Service.schemaFile` for single file

### Steps to reproduce the behavior

**Steps**
1) Create simple `my_lib` module and use default configuration for Apollo plugin. Place GQL schema file into main sources: `/Users/user/projects/sample/my_lib/src/main/graphql/schema.graphqls`
2) Build module with configuration cache enabled `./gradlew :my_lib:assembleDebug --configuration-cache`
3) Rename `schema.graphqls` to `schema2.graphqls`
4) Build module again with configuration cache enabled `./gradlew :my_lib:assembleDebug --configuration-cache`

**Actual result**
The second build fails with error
```
> Task :my_lib:generateMainApolloSources FAILED
Execution failed for task ':my_lib:generateMainApolloSources'.
> java.io.FileNotFoundException: /Users/user/projects/sample/my_lib/src/main/graphql/schema.graphqls (No such file or directory)

* Try:
> Run with --stacktrace option to get the stack trace.
> Run with --info or --debug option to get more log output.
> Run with --scan to get full insights.
> Get more help at https://help.gradle.org.
BUILD FAILED in 307ms
122 actionable tasks: 6 executed, 116 up-to-date
Configuration cache entry reused.
```

**Expected result**
Build must success




### Logs

_No response_

title: Inconsistent simulation of an Autoware agent
body:
Hi.
I have been simulating an Autoware agent with CARLA 0.9.10.1, and experienced inconsistent simulation results.
Given the same mission to drive about 100 meters following a straight lane on the same map (Town 04) with the same environments, there are cases in which the vehicle deviates from the lane with no reason. The same deviation happens in about 10% of the total instances. Please see below for details:

### Required information:

- Operating system and version: Ubuntu 18.04
- CARLA version: 0.9.10.1 (docker image: `carlasim/carla:0.9.10.1`)
- Autoware version: 1.14.0 (docker image: `autoware/autoware:1.14.0-melodic-cuda`)
- Bridge: [carla-autoware-bridge](https://github.com/carla-simulator/carla-autoware) at `975b6f3`
- ROS distribution and version:
  - ROS Melodic (pre-installed in the docker image)
- ROS installation type:
  - Pre-installed in the docker image

### Description of the bug

* Please first see the camera data of the [normal case](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1K7d_3-gYCfcMtqU6XWkHozBPe50ii2YK/view?usp=sharing) and the [buggy case](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1M1F2NM2gaJSXvc971AbaZNBeh_wg8hqk/view?usp=sharing).
  * In the buggy case, a deviation starts right after the vehicle starts driving; it veers to the left as if the wheel alignment is off.
  * As I mentioned before, 90% of the simulation succeeds as in the normal case. In the remaining 10% of the cases, the vehicle diverges from the normal path, and the **diverged path is always the same**.
* Analyzing the control commands CARLA received, this does not seem like a bug in the Autoware:
  * Graph 1: ackermann_cmd of normal / buggy cases (full data)
![sim_error_analysis-1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10861633/117033051-06ab5980-acd0-11eb-9b3e-463e45bc6f27.png)
  * Graph 2: ackermann_cmd of normal / buggy cases (first 10 seconds magnified)
![sim_error_analysis-2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10861633/117033071-09a64a00-acd0-11eb-9d33-b7d4ffcf5e75.png)
The first graph shows the full data of the steering command, until the vehicle either reaches the goal (red line) or crashes into a fence (blue line). As the deviation starts happening almost immediately after the vehicle starts driving, we have to look at the second graph, which shows the data of first 10 seconds.
In the second graph, the steering command CARLA received in the buggy case (blue solid line) did not order the vehicle to steer to the left. It actually did, but by a tiny, negligible amount (< -0.01) which is less than 1% of the maximum negative angle (-1.0). Also, the magnitude of the desired steering angle is even less than that of the normal case, and considering that in the normal case the vehicle drives straight, the initial steering commands of the buggy case shouldn't have affected the path of the vehicle.

### Additional information

* You can find the dump of all ROS messages of the buggy case in the attached [rosbag file](https://drive.google.com/file/d/18MAKoHEPt-GvGwv42ZzxR3S6s6YV8dEq/view?usp=sharing).

title: [Ford Q4] Ford Lightnings Harness Causes Errors When Openpilot Not Running
body:
### Describe the bug

There's currently an issue with F150 Lightnings on the Ford Q4 Harness/CAN-FD platform. This is specific to the Lightning as the ICE variants do not have this issue nor do the Mustang Mach Es.

1. Install Ford Q4 Harness into F150 Lightning.
2. Turn on Vehicle and notice no errors
3. Install Comma Power and plug into harness
4. Turn on vehicle and notice no errors
5. Plug in Comma provided USB-C cable to harness (leaving unplugged from Comma 3/3X)
6. Notice the number of errors received (Traction Control, Park Assist, One Pedal Drive)
7. Plug in Comma 3X (with a working release of OpenPilot) and notice issue persist.
8. Allow Openpilot to fully boot and open the relay on the harness and observe the car faults disappearing

### Which car does this affect?

2022+ Ford F150 Lightning

### Provide a route where the issue occurs

N/A - Happens prior to openpilot

### openpilot version

0.9.5

### Additional info

I've spoken with Discord and they're pretty confused on why this is happening as well. Additionally, there's now 2 Lightnings that are observing this behavior -- mine and one other persons.

I've also emailed support and they were a bit confused as well.

title: Global path planner generates an infeasible global path that cuts through a map
body:
## Bug report

### Required information:

- Operating system and version: Ubuntu 18.04
- Autoware installation type: Docker image `autoware/autoware:1.14.0-melodic-cuda`, as specified in the Dockerfile of `https://github.com/carla-simulator/carla-autoware` at commit `975b6f3`.

- ROS distribution and version:
  - ROS Melodic (pre-installed in the docker image)
- ROS installation type:
  - Pre-installed in the docker image

### Description of the bug

* I am running Autoware 1.14.0 (docker image: `autoware/autoware:1.14.0-melodic-cuda`), Carla 0.9.10.1 (docker image: `carlasim/carla:0.9.10.1`) as a simulator and [carla-autoware-bridge](https://github.com/carla-simulator/carla-autoware) at `975b6f3` as a bridge.
* For an unknown reason, the global path planner generates an infeasible global path that cuts through a map. Following the path, the Autoware vehicle ends up crashing into static objects (fence, houses, ...) in the map.
* Please see the [camera data](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1-0cQbkzyZXI4ycTvJUDg5DTAr0sPMYx9/view?usp=sharing). The vehicle makes a sudden right turn, crashing into a fence.
* Looking at the visualized path, [rviz](https://drive.google.com/file/d/111G9ru7dBJ58B_vzVrRm9vIFTRH51fii/view?usp=sharing), the initial global path itself is infeasible. Pure pursuit did its job in following the global path.
* Please check the [rosbag file](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1leub4kdez46JeckXy2dIHTrOGjihMvkm/view?usp=sharing) for a detailed trace.
* Map files can be downloaded at: [autoware-contents](https://bitbucket.org/carla-simulator/autoware-contents/src/master/maps/).

### Steps to reproduce the bug

1. Replay the self-contained [rosbag file](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1leub4kdez46JeckXy2dIHTrOGjihMvkm/view?usp=sharing).

### Expected behavior
New motion plan should be generated to deal with the blocking object.

### Actual behavior
Motion plan doesn't change, leading to a forward collision.

### Screenshots
* [camera data](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1-0cQbkzyZXI4ycTvJUDg5DTAr0sPMYx9/view?usp=sharing)
* [rviz](https://drive.google.com/file/d/111G9ru7dBJ58B_vzVrRm9vIFTRH51fii/view?usp=sharing)

body:
## Bug report

### Required information:

- Operating system and version: Ubuntu 18.04
- Autoware installation type: Docker image `autoware/autoware:1.14.0-melodic-cuda`, as specified in the Dockerfile of `https://github.com/carla-simulator/carla-autoware` at commit `975b6f3`.

### Description of the bug

* As described in the title, when the orientation of the goal_pos is not aligned with the lane, global planner generates an infeasible path.
  * [Case 1](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1S8ZH6YwYG-KGolMKBLuTvxSe3WXsxQys/view?usp=sharing): Final orientation heads west, the global path cuts through curb.
  * [Case 2](https://drive.google.com/file/d/15_Pz82r4kfgKRZXGA97MNOH4ZLK6kDrK/view?usp=sharing): Final orientation heads east, the global path makes a huge detour, and invades multiple lanes en route.

### Steps to reproduce the bug

* Replay the [rosbag file of case 1](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ICnOlhwHO6sCsc-RGQix0S7oF25z3TFY/view?usp=sharing) and the [rosbag file of case 2](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1anhZx8NAhgxyGpGtI1xlXBPA_tdXA2uU/view?usp=sharing)

### Expected behavior
Path planner should reliably generate feasible paths regardless of the final orientation.

### Actual behavior
Path planner generates infeasible paths if the final orientation is not aligned with the lane.

title: Inconsistent driving area between normal driving and avoidance
body:
### Checklist

- [X] I've read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/autowarefoundation/autoware/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md).
- [X] I've searched other issues and no duplicate issues were found.
- [X] I'm convinced that this is not my fault but a bug.

### Description

Example situation: a bus is driving on a curvy narrow road. Because the vehicle is big and the road is narrow, Autoware estimate the vehicle would not be able to drive the curve without leaving the driving area. However if any object is detected close to the driving lane, avoidance module kicks in and extend the driving area, letting the vehicle drive where it would normally stop.

[avoidance-2023-10-30_17.11.56.webm](https://github.com/autowarefoundation/autoware.universe/assets/18645627/a075b087-45b1-418c-94ea-47ffa4a6b71c)

I don't mind Autoware stopping because the road is too narrow, but if the drivable area can increase when there is an obstacle, why should it be different if there nothing around?

### Expected behavior

If autoware can't drive when the road is too narrow, the existence or not of an obstacle around the path should not change that decision.

### Actual behavior

Drivable area increases.

### Steps to reproduce

Planning simulator with big vehicle on a narrow road

### Versions

_No response_

_No response_

_No response_

title: Localization error underneath a bridge
body:
## Bug report

### Required information:

- Operating system and version: Ubuntu 18.04
- Autoware installation type: Docker image `autoware/autoware:1.14.0-melodic-cuda`, as specified in the Dockerfile of `https://github.com/carla-simulator/carla-autoware` at commit `975b6f3`.
- Autoware version or commit hash - 1.14.0
- ROS distribution and version:
  - ROS Melodic (pre-installed in the docker image)
- ROS installation type:
  - Pre-installed in the docker image

### Description of the bug

* I am running Autoware 1.14.0 (docker image: `autoware/autoware:1.14.0-melodic-cuda`), Carla 0.9.10.1 (docker image: `carlasim/carla:0.9.10.1`) as a simulator and [carla-autoware-bridge](https://github.com/carla-simulator/carla-autoware) at `975b6f3` as a bridge.
* When the ego_vehicle is passing underneath a bridge in Carla's "Town 04" map, the `base_link` frame (i.e., the velodyne frame) gets stranded, while all the other frames including the camera, gnss, imu keep moving forward along the global path. As a result of this discrepancy, the vehicle gets disoriented and crashes into a fence.
* The [camera data](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1snUtkfqfgtt07I_K1PDYpKXQBaeuyFpl/view?usp=sharing) (from 1:40) shows that the camera sensor is moving forward without any problem underneath the bridge.
* However, [rviz](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1zERMJoPa_Xnl9bwMy64gMi4yYTHfp49J/view?usp=sharing) (from 2:34) shows that the vehicle's estimated position (pink arrow) stops moving right before the bridge.
* Please check the [rosbag file](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1rtUJh7AvlWdWTx0M47m5z4HNGLr3vQ7Q/view?usp=sharing) for a detailed trace.
* Map files can be downloaded at: [autoware-contents](https://bitbucket.org/carla-simulator/autoware-contents/src/master/maps/).

### Steps to reproduce the bug

1. Replay the self-contained [rosbag file](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1rtUJh7AvlWdWTx0M47m5z4HNGLr3vQ7Q/view?usp=sharing).

### Expected behavior
All TFs move along the global path without any of them getting stranded.

### Actual behavior
`base_frame` stops moving, resulting in a localization error and a collision.

### Screenshots
* [camera data](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1snUtkfqfgtt07I_K1PDYpKXQBaeuyFpl/view?usp=sharing)
* [rviz](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1zERMJoPa_Xnl9bwMy64gMi4yYTHfp49J/view?usp=sharing)

### Additional information

title: RViz2 with Autoware configuration crashes on high DPI
body:
### Checklist

- [X] I've read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/autowarefoundation/autoware/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md).
- [X] I've searched other issues and no duplicate issues were found.
- [X] I'm convinced that this is not my fault but a bug.

### Description

If the screen dpi is normal, which is generally `xrandr --dpi 96` Autoware RViz2 will function correctly.

But because of some plugins, when the `xrandr --dpi 200` is applied, the RViz2 keeps crashing and restarting.

Also this issue won't happen if you just run the RViz2 with Autoware config with (Autoware shouldn't run, only the rviz2 must be alive):
```
ros2 run rviz2 rviz2 -d /home/mfc/projects/autoware/install/autoware_launch/share/autoware_launch/rviz/autoware.rviz -s /home/mfc/projects/autoware/install/autoware_launch/share/autoware_launch/rviz/image/autoware.png --ros-args -p use_sim_time:=true
```

But if you open the rest of the Autoware, it will crash with a `[ros2run]: Segmentation fault`.

Which plugin causes it, must be investigated.

### Expected behavior

RViz2 runs correctly.

### Actual behavior

RViz2 keeps crashing and restarting.

### Steps to reproduce

```bash
xrandr --dpi 200

ros2 launch autoware_launch planning_simulator.launch.xml map_path:=$HOME/autoware_map/sample-map-planning vehicle_model:=sample_vehicle sensor_model:=sample_sensor_kit
```

[Planning simulator tutorial detailed docs.](https://autowarefoundation.github.io/autoware-documentation/main/tutorials/ad-hoc-simulation/planning-simulation/#1-launch-autoware) 

### Versions

- OS: Ubuntu 22.04
- ROS 2: humble
- Autoware: main

### Possible causes

Some handwritten Autoware plugins cannot cope with varying dpi.

### Additional context

Related Issues & Discussions:
- https://github.com/autowarefoundation/autoware/issues/3173
- https://github.com/orgs/autowarefoundation/discussions/3474
- https://github.com/orgs/autowarefoundation/discussions/3121

title: Reduce excessive error and warning logs on Autoware launch
body:
### Checklist

- [X] I've read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/autowarefoundation/autoware/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md).
- [X] I've searched other issues and no duplicate issues were found.
- [X] I've agreed with the maintainers that I can plan this task.

### Description

When Autoware is executed, it generates a significant number of warning and error logs, despite the system running as expected. The logs are not only excessive but also misrepresent the stability of the running application, as they appear even in the absence of actual functional issues. This creates a noisy debugging environment, making it challenging to identify and address genuine issues.

The issue was replicated using the latest `main` branch with the planning simulator demo as per the Autoware documentation: [Planning Simulation Tutorial](https://autowarefoundation.github.io/autoware-documentation/main/tutorials/ad-hoc-simulation/planning-simulation/).

A video demonstrating the issue is available here:
- [Autoware Error and Warning Logs Video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JDXDh1oNaMg)

The logs from the run that showcase the problem can be found here:
- [Autoware Logs Gist](https://gist.github.com/xmfcx/aebd2fe8a9a7c08a388aafae69dd110a)

### Purpose

The primary goal is to clean up the logs by either resolving the underlying causes of the warnings and errors or by adjusting the threat levels if the logs are not indicative of real issues.
This will aid in de-cluttering the console output, making it easier to debug actual problems, and generally improve the developer experience.


### Possible approaches

1. **Log Analysis**: Go through the logs to determine if the warnings/errors are justified. If they represent real issues, then they should be addressed with bug fixes.
2. **Adjust Log Levels**: If the logs are overly cautious and do not represent actual errors or critical warnings, then the log levels should be adjusted accordingly.
3. **Code Refactoring**: Inspect the sections of the code-base that are generating these logs and refactor if necessary to prevent false positives.
4. **Configuration Tweaks**: Check if the verbosity of the logs can be configured, allowing users to set the desired level of log detail.
5. **Documentation Update**: If certain logs are expected and do not indicate problems, this should be clearly documented to avoid confusion. (last resort, not preferred)
6. **Incremental Fixing**: Tackle the errors and warnings in batches, creating multiple issues or pull requests to address them systematically.

### Definition of done

- [ ] The error and warning logs that are not indicative of actual issues are eliminated or their threat levels are adjusted.
- [ ] The logging output should be clear and should accurately reflect the operational status of Autoware.
- [ ] Documentation should be updated, if necessary, to reflect any changes made to log management.
- [ ] Additional issues should be created for any unresolved logs that require further investigation or long-term changes.
- [ ] The Autoware community agrees that the logging is now informative and not excessively verbose, allowing for effective debugging.

title: Use the cluster speed when limiting speed
body:
The Problem:

Openpilot displays the current speed based off of the speed that is shown in the car's cluster. This is done to prevent a disparity between the car and the information that openpilot is giving, that disparity can lead to less confidence from the user that openpilot is correct. However, the internal openpilot speed is used to limit speed. This leads to openpilot sometimes showing a speed above the set max speed which reduces user confidence that openpilot is correctly limiting based off of the users' max speed setting.

The Solution:
By calculating the difference between the cluster speed and vEgo we can determine the maximum speed that will result in the cluster speed matching the speed the user has set.

title: Honda: check regen paddle
body:
### Describe the bug

## TL;DR

Honda Insight's brake regen adjustment paddles cause OP to throw a CruiseDisabled error instead of canceling cruise control.

## More Info

The Honda Insight has adjustable regenerative braking. This is controlled by paddles on the steering wheel. Hitting either paddle when cruise is engaged will disengage cruise. 

Disengaging cruise control in this fashion causes OP to trigger a "cruise not engaged" message and sound the alarm, instead of gracefully exiting cruise control via the "Cancel" button. This is governed in the Honda interface, [L332](https://github.com/commaai/openpilot/blob/a2bb41e0ec5fd96763e9a01a7116efda059de6e6/selfdrive/car/honda/interface.py#L332).  

It appears that the car sends a generic "Cruise Control disabled" message; there's a lot of junk in Cabana for this trip which isn't mapped to any signals, but one of those could be the issue.

### Desired Outcome

When using the steering wheel paddles to disable cruise control, OP should treat this as a standard disablement instead of an emergency.

### Which car does this affect?

Honda Insight EX 2019

### Provide a route where the issue occurs

8958942b212e8cd9|2023-11-30--08-18-06--10

### openpilot version

On `release3`, latest release.

title: [BUG] infinite loop for incomplete spread
body:
Currently version used for `apollo_parser` crate infinite loop for incomplete spreads in passed graphQL string body.
Being a synchronous task it blocks the process, thus no error is thrown and it keeps on running (unless swc's thread for the file timeout).

This is fixed in version 0.50.x via https://github.com/apollographql/apollo-rs/pull/463

Need to add error handling to graphql ast -> swc ast translation for this version upgrade as few cases like empty named type are not being through from `apollo_parser` at time of parsing query string.

title: Autoware keeps following old local path after `behavior_velocity_planner` is dead
body:
### Checklist

- [X] I've read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/autowarefoundation/autoware/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md).
- [X] I've searched other issues and no duplicate issues were found.
- [X] I'm convinced that this is not my fault but a bug.

### Description

While I experienced the `behavior_velocity_planner` crash (described here: https://github.com/autowarefoundation/autoware.universe/issues/1247), I observed autoware did not make the vehicle stop immediately after the crash, but kept driving along the last generated local path, reached the end of the local path and kept driving straight after. Autoware only triggered an emergency stop when the vehicle was ~3m beyond that last point (out of path detected).

Although the out of path detection range could be reduced to have the emergency triggered earlier, it is very unsafe for autoware to keep following an old local path. For example, even though some new obstacle would be detected on the road, autoware would simply ignore them and follow the last local path it has received.

### Expected behavior

An emergency should be triggered if local paths are not generated anymore

### Actual behavior

Autoware keep driving on the old path, even after its end has been reached.

### Steps to reproduce

1. run autoware on a vehicle
2. kill `behavior_velocity_planner` while in autonomous mode

### Versions

- Ubuntu 20.04
- galactic
- main

### Possible causes

_No response_

_No response_

```
The project is basically a apollo server / gateway.

it works just fine - but then we don't get the [opentelemetry spans emitted by the apollo gateway.](https://www.apollographql.com/docs/federation/opentelemetry/#gateway-specific-spans)

title: Build fails after schema file rename when Gradle configuration cache enabled
body:
### Version

3.8.2 and 4.0.0-beta.3

### Summary

Currently build fails if you rename schema file and configuration cache was enabled. Take a look at the steps to reproduce issue below.

**My current workaround**
I have little bit investigated this and it seems the problem in the following code (schema files searched in a non-compatible way with configuration cache)
https://github.com/apollographql/apollo-kotlin/blob/84f0f9253765ff4bfd8f223539fefd24e8da0488/libraries/apollo-gradle-plugin-external/src/main/kotlin/com/apollographql/apollo3/gradle/internal/DefaultApolloExtension.kt#L965-L970

To workaround this, I set `Service.schemaFiles` directly instead of relying on default behavior.
https://github.com/apollographql/apollo-kotlin/blob/84f0f9253765ff4bfd8f223539fefd24e8da0488/libraries/apollo-gradle-plugin-external/src/main/kotlin/com/apollographql/apollo3/gradle/api/Service.kt#L83

```
apollo {
    service("main") {
        srcDir("src/main/graphql")
        schemaFiles.setFrom(
            fileTree("src/main/graphql") {
                include("**/*.graphqls")
            }
        )
    }
}
```

PS: since in my project I have multiple schema files, I cannot use just `Service.schemaFile` for single file

### Steps to reproduce the behavior

**Steps**
1) Create simple `my_lib` module and use default configuration for Apollo plugin. Place GQL schema file into main sources: `/Users/user/projects/sample/my_lib/src/main/graphql/schema.graphqls`
2) Build module with configuration cache enabled `./gradlew :my_lib:assembleDebug --configuration-cache`
3) Rename `schema.graphqls` to `schema2.graphqls`
4) Build module again with configuration cache enabled `./gradlew :my_lib:assembleDebug --configuration-cache`

**Actual result**
The second build fails with error
```
> Task :my_lib:generateMainApolloSources FAILED
Execution failed for task ':my_lib:generateMainApolloSources'.
> java.io.FileNotFoundException: /Users/user/projects/sample/my_lib/src/main/graphql/schema.graphqls (No such file or directory)

* Try:
> Run with --stacktrace option to get the stack trace.
> Run with --info or --debug option to get more log output.
> Run with --scan to get full insights.
> Get more help at https://help.gradle.org.
BUILD FAILED in 307ms
122 actionable tasks: 6 executed, 116 up-to-date
Configuration cache entry reused.
```

**Expected result**
Build must success




### Logs

_No response_

title: Inconsistent simulation of an Autoware agent
body:
Hi.
I have been simulating an Autoware agent with CARLA 0.9.10.1, and experienced inconsistent simulation results.
Given the same mission to drive about 100 meters following a straight lane on the same map (Town 04) with the same environments, there are cases in which the vehicle deviates from the lane with no reason. The same deviation happens in about 10% of the total instances. Please see below for details:

### Required information:

- Operating system and version: Ubuntu 18.04
- CARLA version: 0.9.10.1 (docker image: `carlasim/carla:0.9.10.1`)
- Autoware version: 1.14.0 (docker image: `autoware/autoware:1.14.0-melodic-cuda`)
- Bridge: [carla-autoware-bridge](https://github.com/carla-simulator/carla-autoware) at `975b6f3`
- ROS distribution and version:
  - ROS Melodic (pre-installed in the docker image)
- ROS installation type:
  - Pre-installed in the docker image

### Description of the bug

* Please first see the camera data of the [normal case](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1K7d_3-gYCfcMtqU6XWkHozBPe50ii2YK/view?usp=sharing) and the [buggy case](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1M1F2NM2gaJSXvc971AbaZNBeh_wg8hqk/view?usp=sharing).
  * In the buggy case, a deviation starts right after the vehicle starts driving; it veers to the left as if the wheel alignment is off.
  * As I mentioned before, 90% of the simulation succeeds as in the normal case. In the remaining 10% of the cases, the vehicle diverges from the normal path, and the **diverged path is always the same**.
* Analyzing the control commands CARLA received, this does not seem like a bug in the Autoware:
  * Graph 1: ackermann_cmd of normal / buggy cases (full data)
![sim_error_analysis-1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10861633/117033051-06ab5980-acd0-11eb-9b3e-463e45bc6f27.png)
  * Graph 2: ackermann_cmd of normal / buggy cases (first 10 seconds magnified)
![sim_error_analysis-2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10861633/117033071-09a64a00-acd0-11eb-9d33-b7d4ffcf5e75.png)
The first graph shows the full data of the steering command, until the vehicle either reaches the goal (red line) or crashes into a fence (blue line). As the deviation starts happening almost immediately after the vehicle starts driving, we have to look at the second graph, which shows the data of first 10 seconds.
In the second graph, the steering command CARLA received in the buggy case (blue solid line) did not order the vehicle to steer to the left. It actually did, but by a tiny, negligible amount (< -0.01) which is less than 1% of the maximum negative angle (-1.0). Also, the magnitude of the desired steering angle is even less than that of the normal case, and considering that in the normal case the vehicle drives straight, the initial steering commands of the buggy case shouldn't have affected the path of the vehicle.

### Additional information

* You can find the dump of all ROS messages of the buggy case in the attached [rosbag file](https://drive.google.com/file/d/18MAKoHEPt-GvGwv42ZzxR3S6s6YV8dEq/view?usp=sharing).

body:

* I am running Autoware 1.14.0 (docker image: `autoware/autoware:1.14.0-melodic-cuda`), Carla 0.9.10.1 (docker image: `carlasim/carla:0.9.10.1`) as a simulator and [carla-autoware-bridge](https://github.com/carla-simulator/carla-autoware) at `975b6f3` as a bridge.
* When the vehicle reaches the end of a steep downhill, the lidar misinterprets the road ahead as an object and the vehicle stops moving.
* Please see the [camera data](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Y06Hq608cnt2BlAyA2qyxiB4hmot5CC1/view?usp=sharing) from 00:10.

* Map files can be downloaded at: [autoware-contents](https://bitbucket.org/carla-simulator/autoware-contents/src/master/maps/).

### Steps to reproduce the bug

1. Replay the self-contained [rosbag file](https://drive.google.com/file/d/13mc42Cm8Zo9GWSzupIiKilQRU6G7A27c/view?usp=sharing).

### Expected behavior
The street should not be perceived as an object.

### Actual behavior
The street is perceived as an object, and Autoware vehicle refuses to move forward as it thinks its way is blocked.

### Description of the bug

* I am running Autoware 1.14.0 (docker image: `autoware/autoware:1.14.0-melodic-cuda`), Carla 0.9.10.1 (docker image: `carlasim/carla:0.9.10.1`) as a simulator and [carla-autoware-bridge](https://github.com/carla-simulator/carla-autoware) at `975b6f3` as a bridge.
* For an unknown reason, the global path planner generates an infeasible global path that cuts through a map. Following the path, the Autoware vehicle ends up crashing into static objects (fence, houses, ...) in the map.
* Please see the [camera data](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1-0cQbkzyZXI4ycTvJUDg5DTAr0sPMYx9/view?usp=sharing). The vehicle makes a sudden right turn, crashing into a fence.
* Looking at the visualized path, [rviz](https://drive.google.com/file/d/111G9ru7dBJ58B_vzVrRm9vIFTRH51fii/view?usp=sharing), the initial global path itself is infeasible. Pure pursuit did its job in following the global path.
* Please check the [rosbag file](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1leub4kdez46JeckXy2dIHTrOGjihMvkm/view?usp=sharing) for a detailed trace.
* Map files can be downloaded at: [autoware-contents](https://bitbucket.org/carla-simulator/autoware-contents/src/master/maps/).

### Steps to reproduce the bug

1. Replay the self-contained [rosbag file](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1leub4kdez46JeckXy2dIHTrOGjihMvkm/view?usp=sharing).

### Expected behavior
New motion plan should be generated to deal with the blocking object.

### Actual behavior
Motion plan doesn't change, leading to a forward collision.

### Screenshots
* [camera data](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1-0cQbkzyZXI4ycTvJUDg5DTAr0sPMYx9/view?usp=sharing)
* [rviz](https://drive.google.com/file/d/111G9ru7dBJ58B_vzVrRm9vIFTRH51fii/view?usp=sharing)

### Additional information

* As described in the title, when the orientation of the goal_pos is not aligned with the lane, global planner generates an infeasible path.

### Expected behavior
Path planner should reliably generate feasible paths regardless of the final orientation.

### Actual behavior
Path planner generates infeasible paths if the final orientation is not aligned with the lane.

title: Inconsistent driving area between normal driving and avoidance
body:
### Checklist

- [X] I've read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/autowarefoundation/autoware/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md).
- [X] I've searched other issues and no duplicate issues were found.
- [X] I'm convinced that this is not my fault but a bug.

### Description

Example situation: a bus is driving on a curvy narrow road. Because the vehicle is big and the road is narrow, Autoware estimate the vehicle would not be able to drive the curve without leaving the driving area. However if any object is detected close to the driving lane, avoidance module kicks in and extend the driving area, letting the vehicle drive where it would normally stop.

[avoidance-2023-10-30_17.11.56.webm](https://github.com/autowarefoundation/autoware.universe/assets/18645627/a075b087-45b1-418c-94ea-47ffa4a6b71c)

I don't mind Autoware stopping because the road is too narrow, but if the drivable area can increase when there is an obstacle, why should it be different if there nothing around?

### Expected behavior

If autoware can't drive when the road is too narrow, the existence or not of an obstacle around the path should not change that decision.

### Actual behavior

Drivable area increases.

### Steps to reproduce

Planning simulator with big vehicle on a narrow road

title: Localization error underneath a bridge
body:
## Bug report

### Required information:

- Operating system and version: Ubuntu 18.04
- Autoware installation type: Docker image `autoware/autoware:1.14.0-melodic-cuda`, as specified in the Dockerfile of `https://github.com/carla-simulator/carla-autoware` at commit `975b6f3`.
- Autoware version or commit hash - 1.14.0
- ROS distribution and version:
  - ROS Melodic (pre-installed in the docker image)
- ROS installation type:
  - Pre-installed in the docker image

### Description of the bug

* I am running Autoware 1.14.0 (docker image: `autoware/autoware:1.14.0-melodic-cuda`), Carla 0.9.10.1 (docker image: `carlasim/carla:0.9.10.1`) as a simulator and [carla-autoware-bridge](https://github.com/carla-simulator/carla-autoware) at `975b6f3` as a bridge.
* When the ego_vehicle is passing underneath a bridge in Carla's "Town 04" map, the `base_link` frame (i.e., the velodyne frame) gets stranded, while all the other frames including the camera, gnss, imu keep moving forward along the global path. As a result of this discrepancy, the vehicle gets disoriented and crashes into a fence.
* The [camera data](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1snUtkfqfgtt07I_K1PDYpKXQBaeuyFpl/view?usp=sharing) (from 1:40) shows that the camera sensor is moving forward without any problem underneath the bridge.
* However, [rviz](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1zERMJoPa_Xnl9bwMy64gMi4yYTHfp49J/view?usp=sharing) (from 2:34) shows that the vehicle's estimated position (pink arrow) stops moving right before the bridge.
* Please check the [rosbag file](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1rtUJh7AvlWdWTx0M47m5z4HNGLr3vQ7Q/view?usp=sharing) for a detailed trace.
* Map files can be downloaded at: [autoware-contents](https://bitbucket.org/carla-simulator/autoware-contents/src/master/maps/).

### Steps to reproduce the bug

1. Replay the self-contained [rosbag file](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1rtUJh7AvlWdWTx0M47m5z4HNGLr3vQ7Q/view?usp=sharing).

### Expected behavior
All TFs move along the global path without any of them getting stranded.

### Actual behavior
`base_frame` stops moving, resulting in a localization error and a collision.

### Screenshots

title: RViz2 with Autoware configuration crashes on high DPI
body:
### Checklist

- [X] I've read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/autowarefoundation/autoware/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md).
- [X] I've searched other issues and no duplicate issues were found.
- [X] I'm convinced that this is not my fault but a bug.

### Description

If the screen dpi is normal, which is generally `xrandr --dpi 96` Autoware RViz2 will function correctly.

But because of some plugins, when the `xrandr --dpi 200` is applied, the RViz2 keeps crashing and restarting.

Also this issue won't happen if you just run the RViz2 with Autoware config with (Autoware shouldn't run, only the rviz2 must be alive):
```
ros2 run rviz2 rviz2 -d /home/mfc/projects/autoware/install/autoware_launch/share/autoware_launch/rviz/autoware.rviz -s /home/mfc/projects/autoware/install/autoware_launch/share/autoware_launch/rviz/image/autoware.png --ros-args -p use_sim_time:=true
```

But if you open the rest of the Autoware, it will crash with a `[ros2run]: Segmentation fault`.

Which plugin causes it, must be investigated.

### Expected behavior

RViz2 runs correctly.

### Actual behavior

RViz2 keeps crashing and restarting.

### Steps to reproduce

```bash
xrandr --dpi 200

ros2 launch autoware_launch planning_simulator.launch.xml map_path:=$HOME/autoware_map/sample-map-planning vehicle_model:=sample_vehicle sensor_model:=sample_sensor_kit
```

[Planning simulator tutorial detailed docs.](https://autowarefoundation.github.io/autoware-documentation/main/tutorials/ad-hoc-simulation/planning-simulation/#1-launch-autoware) 

### Versions

- OS: Ubuntu 22.04
- ROS 2: humble
- Autoware: main

### Possible causes

Some handwritten Autoware plugins cannot cope with varying dpi.

### Additional context

Related Issues & Discussions:
- https://github.com/autowarefoundation/autoware/issues/3173
- https://github.com/orgs/autowarefoundation/discussions/3474
- https://github.com/orgs/autowarefoundation/discussions/3121

title: Reduce excessive error and warning logs on Autoware launch
body:
### Checklist

- [X] I've read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/autowarefoundation/autoware/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md).
- [X] I've searched other issues and no duplicate issues were found.
- [X] I've agreed with the maintainers that I can plan this task.

### Description

When Autoware is executed, it generates a significant number of warning and error logs, despite the system running as expected. The logs are not only excessive but also misrepresent the stability of the running application, as they appear even in the absence of actual functional issues. This creates a noisy debugging environment, making it challenging to identify and address genuine issues.

The issue was replicated using the latest `main` branch with the planning simulator demo as per the Autoware documentation: [Planning Simulation Tutorial](https://autowarefoundation.github.io/autoware-documentation/main/tutorials/ad-hoc-simulation/planning-simulation/).

A video demonstrating the issue is available here:
- [Autoware Error and Warning Logs Video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JDXDh1oNaMg)

The logs from the run that showcase the problem can be found here:
- [Autoware Logs Gist](https://gist.github.com/xmfcx/aebd2fe8a9a7c08a388aafae69dd110a)

### Purpose

The primary goal is to clean up the logs by either resolving the underlying causes of the warnings and errors or by adjusting the threat levels if the logs are not indicative of real issues.
This will aid in de-cluttering the console output, making it easier to debug actual problems, and generally improve the developer experience.


### Possible approaches

1. **Log Analysis**: Go through the logs to determine if the warnings/errors are justified. If they represent real issues, then they should be addressed with bug fixes.
2. **Adjust Log Levels**: If the logs are overly cautious and do not represent actual errors or critical warnings, then the log levels should be adjusted accordingly.
3. **Code Refactoring**: Inspect the sections of the code-base that are generating these logs and refactor if necessary to prevent false positives.
4. **Configuration Tweaks**: Check if the verbosity of the logs can be configured, allowing users to set the desired level of log detail.
5. **Documentation Update**: If certain logs are expected and do not indicate problems, this should be clearly documented to avoid confusion. (last resort, not preferred)
6. **Incremental Fixing**: Tackle the errors and warnings in batches, creating multiple issues or pull requests to address them systematically.

### Definition of done

- [ ] The error and warning logs that are not indicative of actual issues are eliminated or their threat levels are adjusted.
- [ ] The logging output should be clear and should accurately reflect the operational status of Autoware.
- [ ] Documentation should be updated, if necessary, to reflect any changes made to log management.
- [ ] Additional issues should be created for any unresolved logs that require further investigation or long-term changes.
- [ ] The Autoware community agrees that the logging is now informative and not excessively verbose, allowing for effective debugging.

title: Centerpoint tiny does not detect any object
body:

  frame_id: base_link

No issue when `centerpoint_model_name` is set to `centerpoint`:

Nothing is detected
